moves.1. d4: The Queen's Pawn opening, which has a reputation for leading to slow, positional battles. Not this time!
moves.1... c5: By avoiding 1...P-Q4 in response, Tate opens the game up to be tactical at once.
moves.3. Nc3: Yermolinsky develops and guards his advanced Pawn.
moves.4... Ne7: Tate develops a piece and prepares to exchange off Yermolinsky's advanced Knight.
moves.5. Bg5: Yermolinsky prevents the exchange by means of a pin.
moves.7. c3: Rather than retreat his Knight, Yermolinsky interposes with a Pawn.
moves.7... Nf5: Tate frees his KB to develop and threatens Yermolinsky's Bishop.
moves.8. Qa4: Very clever move by Yermolinsky. If Tate retreats his Q along the diagonal, he loses it. If Tate takes Yermolinsky's Queen instead...
moves.9. Nc7#: ...he gets checkmated. Nicely played by Yermolinsky!
